answer: The symptoms of alpha thalassemia major include severe anemia as early as the first trimester of pregnancy, enlargement of the placenta, heart, liver, spleen, and adrenal glands, fluid accumulation throughout the body, growth retardation, and increased risk of complications during pregnancy and delivery. Most affected fetuses miscarry or die shortly after birth. Women carrying affected fetuses are at increased risk of developing toxemia, premature delivery, delivery by cesarean section, and hemorrhage after delivery.
